ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual synchronous and asynchronous work
Live virtual lectures and asynchronous work.
Friday one-on-one discussion/speaking sessions with the professor.
Virtual seminar monday tuesday thursday, at-home assignments wednesday friday

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned more Indonesian and improved my speaking ability
Bahasa Indonesia talking, writing, and listening skills in a fun classroom environment!
Indonesian!
We expanded our knowledge of Indonesian, learned about the culture and various facets of culture in Indonesia, and developed more natural conversational skills.
I learned a lot of Indonesia's culture and language (i.e. grammar, phrases, colloquialisms, etc.).
Learned more about the Indonesian language and culture

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths:  fun class and topic, loved learning about the culture.
Weaknesses: doesnt really work with the online format
This class is fantastic. Bu Dinny is an absolutely awesome professor, she makes every class fun and interesting. It is a great way to learn Bahasa in a classroom environment. Highly recommended!

I loved the structure of the course and thought it had a good balance between seminar and section. However, I would have liked to have more feedback from important assignments and the midterm earlier.
Course was administered well, the use of two at-home assignment days was effective as well as ngobrol and group projects

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: More synchronous time/meetings, less asynchronous work

Bu Dinny was successful in transitioning this class to a virtual format - making sure that everyone was engaged over Zoom, and sharing media. 

Improvement - could come from a better way to turn in assignments over Canvas rather than Google Drive (to standardize submissions with other classes)
The course was very successful in the covid-19 environmen

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If they want to continue their Indonesian
Highly recommended!

Bu Dinny is a kind and understanding professor! I am so thankful for my semester with her as a professor. The INDO department at Yale is phenomenal and has truly shaped the way I look at different cultures and languages.

Absolutely! Bu Dinny is an amazing professor and tries to make every aspect of class fun and engaging. We got to learn about so much more than the language, including Indonesia's politics, cultures, religions,  peoples, cuisine, and fashion. Hands down, the language prof yang paling kerennn!
I would recommend this course for students who want to continue their learning of Indonesian and learn more about the culture as well
